TIME.comment: Relative julian days with decimal part as parts of the day

WDIR.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

WSPD.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

WDIR_2.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

WSPD_2.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

WDIR_3.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

WSPD_3.instrument: Calculated on ship from relative wind and GPS

TEMP.comment: The height attribute refers to the depth of the seawater intake below the vessel's Summer Water Line when the port drop keel is flush with the ship's hull. However, the actual depth of the seawater intake is height-KEEL_EXT. The KEEL_EXT can vary throughout a cruise. For KEEL_EXT=0 the SBE 38 sensor will not operate.

TEMP_2.instrument: University of Southampton ISAR SST Radiometer (s/n ISAR5D_010)
TEMP_2.comment: The ISAR measures SST approximately every 2.5 minutes and for any minute the most recent measurement is used.

TIME_quality_control.quality_control_flag_values: B, C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, Q, S, T, U, V, X, Z
TIME_quality_control.quality_control_flag_meanings: Value_out_of_bounds Time_not_sequential Failed_T_Tw_Td_test Failed_true_wind_recomputation_test Platform_velocity_unrealistic Value_exceeds_threshold Discontinuity Erroneous_value Suspect_value_(visual) Value_located_over_land Instrument_malfunction Pre-flagged_as_suspect Spike_in_data_(visual) Time_duplicate Suspect_value_(statistical) Step_in_data_(statistical) Spike_in_data_(statistical) Value_passed_all_tests

TS2_SD.long_name: total expanded uncertainty for sea temperature (radiometric)
TS2_SD.instrument: University of Southampton ISAR SST Radiometer (s/n ISAR5D_010)
TS2_SD.comment: This is the total expanded uncertainty for the ISAR radiometric skin SST (TS2) value, being a combination of random (type A), systematic (type B), instrument and measurement uncertainty.  The ISAR expanded uncertainty is an estimate of the SST that differs from its true value by less than the stated uncertainty in 95 % of cases, and can be considered as 2 times the standard deviation.  Note this is the absolute value of the uncertainty_sd value output from the Werenfrid Wimmer ISAR uncertainty code, documented in Wimmer, W., and I. Robinson, 2016, The ISAR instrument uncertainty model. J. Atmos. Oceanic Technol. doi:10.1175/JTECH-D-16-0096.1. http://journals.ametsoc.org/doi/abs/10.1175/JTECH-D-16-0096.1

TS2_SD_quality_control.quality_control_flag_values: B, C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, Q, S, T, U, V, X, Z
TS2_SD_quality_control.quality_control_flag_meanings: Value_out_of_bounds Time_not_sequential Failed_T_Tw_Td_test Failed_true_wind_recomputation_test Platform_velocity_unrealistic Value_exceeds_threshold Discontinuity Erroneous_value Suspect_value_(visual) Value_located_over_land Instrument_malfunction Pre-flagged_as_suspect Spike_in_data_(visual) Time_duplicate Suspect_value_(statistical) Step_in_data_(statistical) Spike_in_data_(statistical) Value_passed_all_tests

TEMP_2_SD.long_name: total expanded uncertainty for sea temperature (radiometric)
TEMP_2_SD.instrument: University of Southampton ISAR SST Radiometer (s/n ISAR5D_010)
TEMP_2_SD.comment: This is the total expanded uncertainty for the ISAR radiometric skin SST (TEMP_2) value, being a combination of random (type A), systematic (type B), instrument and measurement uncertainty.  The ISAR expanded uncertainty is an estimate of the SST that differs from its true value by less than the stated uncertainty in 95 % of cases, and can be considered as 2 times the standard deviation.  Note this is the absolute value of the uncertainty_sd value output from the Werenfrid Wimmer ISAR uncertainty code, documented in Wimmer, W., and I. Robinson, 2016, The ISAR instrument uncertainty model. J. Atmos. Oceanic Technol. doi:10.1175/JTECH-D-16-0096.1. http://journals.ametsoc.org/doi/abs/10.1175/JTECH-D-16-0096.1

aws_opendata_registry.Name: Ships of Opportunity - Air-sea fluxes - Meteorological and sea surface temperature - Real time
aws_opendata_registry.Description: Enhancement of Measurements on Ships of Opportunity (SOOP)-Air Sea Flux sub-facility collects underway meteorological and oceanographic observations during scientific and Antarctic resupply voyages in the oceans adjacent to Australia. Data product is quality controlled observations. Research Vessel Real Time Air-Sea Fluxes, equips the Marine National Facility (MNF) (Research Vessels Southern Surveyor and Investigator), the Australian Antarctic Division (Research and Supply Vessels Aurora Australis and Nuyina), and Research Vessel Tangaroa with "climate quality" meteorological measurement systems, capable of providing high quality air-sea flux measurements and delivered to researchers on a near real-time basis. Obtaining the full set of air-sea fluxes essential for climate studies requires observations of: wind, air and sea temperature, humidity, pressure, precipitation, long- and short-wave radiation. The existing ship meteorological sensor sets are completed with IMOS instruments and a comprehensive annual calibration program implemented. Data streams are fed into existing ship data management systems, and broadcast via satellite back to Australia routinely. The observations are quality controlled at the Bureau of Meteorology. A daily file of 1-minute averages of the observations are generated shortly after 0000UTC and provided to IMOS.

Resources.Description: Cloud Optimised AODN dataset of IMOS - SOOP-Air Sea Flux (ASF) sub-facility - Meteorological and SST Observations

Tutorials.Title: Accessing IMOS - SOOP-Air Sea Flux (ASF) sub-facility - Meteorological and SST Observations
